messages: 8aea2fb1f46a65ba9db7fe4a440d9097 (02:57): has the Blade 1000 the same system board as the Blade 2000?
7c1792c03c5ce7d1af1119856c83a48a (02:58): not sure...isn't the blade 1000 an Aladin IV chipset?
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (03:01): and its about as far away from a aladin chipset as a vacuum cleaner is
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (03:01): sunsolve has all that detailed info
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (03:02): yes the 100 is some el cheapo pc chipset that got modified
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (03:03): 1000/2000 is a sun psyhco chipset
8aea2fb1f46a65ba9db7fe4a440d9097 (03:04): what a kewl machine i have =)
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (03:04): blade 1000 is a nice box
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (03:05): and the 2000 is the same, just with faster defaukt CPUs
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (03:06): oh, 4143 is obsoleted, btw, they say to use one of the others instead
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (03:08): wondering WTF "900MHz UltraSPARC III Cu Module
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (03:09): can yes, but not sold with
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (03:09): the CU where the reason for the 2000, beside the 20 years of sun back then when the 2000 came out
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (03:10): internal fc-al and extranal copper fc-al connector
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (03:12): i wonder which blade my coworker has
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (03:14): ah, 1.5Ghz ultraIII, single CPU only, ATA disks :-/
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (03:14): he just uses it as an x-term :-/
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (03:15): mostly for shell sessions to our sun servers
d7b02719c780a791ff147479f6d18a24 (03:43): I want an "enterprise monitoring" app which compares the resources used and available on users' systems and recommends swaps to "improve efficiency"
1440dfc7850e5d6b30d7829e25b44c99 (04:07): How do I change my library search path on a solaris system? (I am not the administrator of the system, the changes should be only local to my current user)
5ca559c44d113ea4b7115a4a5563006f (04:09): then you're stuck using LD_LIBRARY_PATH (environment variable)
81fe0e26b4a2885db55ccaee930af431 (04:10): where can I find solaris for vmware ?
1440dfc7850e5d6b30d7829e25b44c99 (04:11): insomnia: I've tried to get crle to work, but it doesn't seem to want to do anything without admin.
5ca559c44d113ea4b7115a4a5563006f (04:17): znull: uh. that's Solaris x86. Just use that.
5ca559c44d113ea4b7115a4a5563006f (04:17): yes, you have to be ROOT to use crle :)
1440dfc7850e5d6b30d7829e25b44c99 (04:22): LD_LIBRARY_PATH fails. I should have specified that I am trying to compile.
1440dfc7850e5d6b30d7829e25b44c99 (04:23): I am not trying to run a binary, I'm trying to run ./configure successfully right now.
e282c1b5ca7363d9439f97f76f10056d (04:23): then build your application CORRECTLY
1440dfc7850e5d6b30d7829e25b44c99 (04:24): How am I not building it correctly?
1440dfc7850e5d6b30d7829e25b44c99 (04:24): And I need it to use a library installed in
e282c1b5ca7363d9439f97f76f10056d (04:24): pass the appropriate linker options
e282c1b5ca7363d9439f97f76f10056d (04:25): that's left as an exercise to the reader
5ca559c44d113ea4b7115a4a5563006f (04:37): just set LDFLAGS="-R/path" for any place you have non-standard libs before the configure.
5ca559c44d113ea4b7115a4a5563006f (04:39): for the ./configure, run it with --help and see what the option is for the libs you need. You'll run something like ./configure --with-krb5=/foo/krb5
5ca559c44d113ea4b7115a4a5563006f (04:40): Foorael: don't give it the lib dir, it likely wants the root of the install, so it can access include/ and lib/ at the path you give.
5ca559c44d113ea4b7115a4a5563006f (04:44): come to think of it, I don't think I've ever seen a "building software" FAQ that describes all these things.
1440dfc7850e5d6b30d7829e25b44c99 (04:46): charlieS: I've gotten it to work on linux by overriding some environment variables, but I've not used solaris before.
5ca559c44d113ea4b7115a4a5563006f (04:46): its the same.. in that sense.
